Eating foods that are high in proteins such as eggs, meats, nuts and dairy can provide energy for muscle growth and repair. Eating healthy fats such as avocados, chia seeds, nuts and salmon can help provide energy and keep someone feeling full for longer periods of time. Additionally, foods that are high in fiber such as oats, legumes and vegetables can help regulate the digestive system, which can help increase energy levels.

Additionally, staying hydrated with water is essential for energy production, as the body needs water to metabolize food.
